# Manufacturers Building (Rockingham, North Carolina)

| locmapin    = North Carolina#USA
| built       = c.
| added       = May 29, 1979
| area        = less than one acre
| refnum      = 79003348
}}
Manufacturers Building is a historic commercial building located at Rockingham, Richmond County, North Carolina.  It was built about 1904, and is a two-story, cream-colored brick commercial building. Its brickwork is in common bond.  It has a high hipped and slate covered roof.  The building served as the administrative offices for five of the most important textile mills in Richmond Countyâ€”Pee Dee Manufacturing Company, Steele's Mills, Roberdel Mills, Midway Mills, and Hannah Pickett Mills.
It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1979.
